alert.note: Alert for Summit (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 3:45PM MDT until August 11 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dry wash and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Utah, including the following county, Summit. * WHEN...Until 515 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes along and over the Chalk Creek Road. Some low-water crossings have become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 341 PM MDT, local law enforcement reported that up to a foot of water debris has crossed the Chalk Creek Road from earlier thunderstorms. Additional dry wash and small stream flooding is likely occurring. - Side drainages along Chalk Creek Road is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coalville and Hoytsville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
